item.description: Ben There, Dan That! / Time Gentlemen, Please!

item.description: Covering the early years of Squaresoft's flagship series. Full article on www.socksmakepeoplesexy.net

item.title: Kenji Eno's Warp and the D legacy
item.description: A loose series of horror-themed games by one of the most peculiar creative heads of the industry

item.title: Konami Beat-'em-ups
item.description: Arcade games based on The Simpsons, X-Men, Bucky O'Hare, Asterix, plus original titles Metamorphic Force, and Gaiapolis

item.title: Konami Run and Guns
item.description: Shooter/platformers that include Sunset Riders, Mystic Warriors, Devastators, Aliens, and many others

item.title: Konami Shoot-'em-ups
item.description: Including Scramble, Gyruss, Time Pilot, Axelay, XEXEX, Ajax, Thunder Cross, Crisis Force, and many, many more

item.title: Love-De-Lic
item.description: The quirky company behind Moon RPG, UFO and Lack of Love, who later went on to form Skip

item.title: Natsume NES Action Games
item.description: Abadox, Shadow of the Ninja, S.C.A.T., and Shatterhand. Some very good, overlooked classics

item.title: Nippon Ichi Strategy RPGs
item.description: Hilarious and impossibly in-depth strategy games, including La Pucelle, Disgaea, Phantom Brave, Makai Kingdom and Soul Cradle

item.title: Nosferatu
item.description: Three very different horror games - a British microcomputer isometric adventure, a SNES cinematic platformer and a 21st century first person shooter - all united by one name

item.title: Polygon Magic Fighting Games
item.description: Fighter's Impact, Vs. and Shaolin / Lord of Fist

item.title: Post-Mortem Dreamcast Shooters
item.description: All of the shooters for the DC from Border Down to Karous, including Radirgy, Chaos Field, Psyvariar 2, Trigger Heart Exelica, and Under Defeat

item.title: Pre-Street Fighter II Fighting Games
item.description: Over fifty one-on-one fighting games that predated Capcom's genre defining classic

item.title: Quintet 'Heaven and Earth Trilogy'
item.description: Quintet's action-RPGs, including Soul Blazer, Illusion of Gaia, Terranigma, and The Granstream Saga

item.title: Raizing/Eighting Shooters
item.description: Mahou Daisakusen, Armed Police Batrider, Battle Garegga, Dimahoo and more

item.title: Ranma 1/2 SFC Fighters
item.description: Three fighting games, one of which got rebranded in the West as Street Combat

item.title: Sega Ages
item.description: A look at all 33 titles in the PlayStation 2 series, featuring remakes, ports, and compilations of classic Sega games

item.title: Spacewar! Legacy
item.description: Tells how the very first proper video game came to be, and traces its direct influence through the decades

item.title: Sting RPGs
item.description: A bunch of innovative games from Sting, known for Riviera, Yggdra Union, Baroque, Treasure Hunter G, Evolution, and others

item.title: Sumo 2D Games
item.description: A look at a number of Japanese-only 2D sumo wrestling titles

item.title: Sunsoft Fighting Games
item.description: Galaxy Fight, Waku Waku 7 and Astra Superstars - a trilogy of wacky 2D fighters from Sunsoft

item.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
item.description: One multi-million selling franchise, four Turtles, more than twenty games, lots of pizza

item.title: Terminal Reality Horror Games
item.description: Nocturne, Blair Witch and the BloodRayne franchise, including the comics and the terrible movies by Uwe Boll

item.title: Toaplan Shooters
item.description: Tiger Heli, Truxton, Zero Wing, Twin Cobra, Dogyuun, Batsugun, and more

item.title: Vic Tokai Platformers
item.description: Covering various unrelated platformers that nonetheless share certaon design principles: Kid Cool, Psycho Fox, Magical Hat no Buttobi Turbo Daibouken and Decap Attack

item.title: Zelda CD-I Games
item.description: Defending the two fortuneless sidescrolling action-adventures by Philips: Link: The Faces of Evil, and Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon

item.title: Zyrinx
item.description: Creators of Red Zone and Subterrania for the Genesis, amongst others
